messages.title: Martin Horwood has been standing up for Cheltenham's NHS since 2005
messages.content: It has never been more important to stand up for the local NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigning to save the maternity ward at Cheltenham General Hospital and to defend the emergency department so the full overnight A&E service is retained in Cheltenham.
Martin campaigns for better mental health services in Gloucestershire, giving more local young and old the chance of good mental health services in specialist units in the UK.
Focused on retaining the A&E department and against any downgrading of this essential service.
Protecting the local availability of IVF treatments for childless couples.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lib Dems pledge £8bn boost for our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Lib Dems will focus extra funding on key priorities - mental health and prevention, while also reducing cost pressures on other areas to help NHS funding remain sustainable.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Martin Horwood and the Lib Dems build a fairer society.

issues.environment: Martin has always strongly supported campaigns to protect treasured green spaces around Cheltenham.
issues.health: Martin Horwood has campaigned for many years as Cheltenham's MP since 2005 to stand up for the local NHS, including campaigning to save the maternity ward at Cheltenham General Hospital and to defend the emergency department.

leaflet.personalStatement: 'It's hard work but it's also an honour to represent you in Parliament. If you're kind enough to vote for me again, you know I'll keep standing up for Cheltenham regardless of who's in government.' - Martin Horwood

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigning for local NHS, saving the maternity ward, better mental health services, supporting green spaces

contactInformation.address: Liberal Democrats, 16 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham, GL52 6AA

images.caption: Martin Horwood with supporters and residents advocating for the local NHS.
Martin Horwood in an outdoor setting.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Help Martin Horwood and the Lib Dems build a fairer society by displaying a garden poster.
